titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1721: Tune book.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of hymns with lyrics, folk song tunes without lyrics, several pages of music theory notes at the beginning, and a French horn minuet (p. 31). The front and back pastedowns and first and last leaves contain miscellaneous notes, accounts, and calculations dating to around 1770.

supportDesc.extent: 30 leaves : 98 x 158 mm bound to 105 x 164 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 30 leaves; [1-60]; modern pagination in pencil, upper outer corners.

layoutDesc.layout: Notation written in 4 staves per page; hand-ruled in ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by what appears to be a single hand.

binding.p: Contemporary leather over pasteboards. Leather of upper cover is badly deteriorating and coming loose from board. Bookseller's advertisement pasted onto inside upper cover.

origin.p: Written in England circa 1758 (owner note, p. 1).

history.provenance: Sold at auction by Lyon & Turnbull (Edinburgh), 9 September 2014, lot 93.
